trustfund:
TF094735-IMPACT AND PROCESS EVALUATION
            OF SMALLHOLDER BIOGAS IN CHINA
topicv3: On-farm Livestock m1326879 1954,Agricultural Trade m1327604 192,Farm Household Consumption m1326643 1969,Agricultural Policies m1326884 170,On-Farm Storage m1326442 1971

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Eco-Farming Project for
            China were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: favorable national regulatory
            frameworks and policy instruments for biogas development and
            livestock pollution control provided legal ground and
            financial incentives for a successful project
            implementation. Stakeholders' commitment, dedication,
            and capabilities are critical to ensure project success,
            sustainability, and ownership. Despite attractive financial
            returns and positive social and environmental benefits of
            the project investment, up-front significant subsidies as
            financial incentives are required to share the initial
            capital cost of the project facilities to help mobilize
            household participation. One of the key reasons for the
            smooth operation of the clean development mechanism (CDM)
            pilot program was the integration of the CDM operations into
            the Bank loan investment project.
